poem:
The Last Days

A pair, like leaves beside the street  
where the mind unwinds  
its fragile thread—  
beyond the break, the shadow  
of Nancy North,  
veiled in morning light.  
She stirs the air with questions,  
each day a threadbare mystery,  
bound yet set adrift  
in the swift, turning world.
